thread.title: Intense heat followed by strong storms today in Maryland - CBS Baltimore
thread.title_full: Intense heat followed by strong storms today in Maryland - CBS Baltimore

title: Intense heat followed by strong storms today in Maryland - CBS Baltimore
text:
BALTIMORE --An active and warm pattern continues this weekend with daily afternoon shower and thunderstorm chances. A Flood Watch will also go into effect from 3-10 p.m. today for parts of the region. Be sure to stay tuned to the First Alert Weather team for updates.
 Saturday
 It's a warm and humid day ahead with temperatures in the low 90s for most. A few more clouds around after lunch with showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening, some of which could turn severe. If you are planning to be outside and perhaps attending Artscape, please stay hydrated and remain weather aware. These storms could produce heavy rain in a short amount of time, hail and damaging winds. A Flood Watch also goes into effect from 3-10 p.m. for parts of the area. Be sure to stay tuned to the First Alert Weather team for updates.
Saturday Night
 A few scattered showers and storms are possible overnight. It's mostly cloudy with lows in the low 70s.
Sunday
Another day of heat and humidity with daytime highs in the low 90s. Partly sunny skies return with afternoon showers and thunderstorms popping up once again. However, thunderstorm chances tomorrow look to be more scattered in nature.
Sunday Night
Conditions quiet down by Sunday night with mostly clear skies and temperatures in the low 70s.
Monday is still quite hot and sunny with highs in the low to mid-90s but hang in there a break from the heat arrives midweek.
Tuesday features daytime highs in the low 90s, partly sunny skies, and the slight chance for an afternoon shower or thunderstorm.
By midweek, isolated to scattered PM shower and thunderstorm chances return, but we should enjoy a break from the high heat. Showers may impact us Thursday and Friday of next week. The rain is much needed as drought conditions continue to worsen over a good portion of Maryland.
More from CBS News Maryland Weather: Alert Day through Friday for dangerous heat Maryland Weather: Alert Days for extreme heat Thursday & Friday Baltimore issues Code Red Extreme Heat Alert ahead of Artscape weekend Marylanders finding ways to beat the intense 100-degree heat Artscape performances cancelled Friday due to emergency flash flood warning
